[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 299476575 by [[Special:Contributions/Jarvis76|Jarvis76]] ([[User talk:Jarvis76|talk]]) rv banned sock account
If indeed 1,500,000 Armenians died, then what was the number of the "total Armenian population" before the war? Luckily "serious" sources like Britannica are run by "scientists" and not "politicians"
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 299475377 by [[Special:Contributions/Jarvis76|Jarvis76]] ([[User talk:Jarvis76|talk]]) incorrect: the number widely cited is 1M to 1.5M
Those "estimates" are based on which archives? These are the only "universally credible" sources and the total Ottoman Armenian population was 1,800,000 before the war.
modern estimates

Sorry, correcting myself: 1,750,000 is Britannica's own estimate, while 1,800,000 is Toynbee's estimate, for the total number of Ottoman Armenians in 1915. Toynbee estimates that 600,000 of them died.

Arnold J. Toynbee estimates that 600,000 Armenians died, out of a total of 1,750,000 deported. http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/35323/Armenian-massacres/35323suppinfo/Supplemental-Information
